title: Improve image checks for generic camera
body:
<!--
  You are amazing! Thanks for contributing to our project!
  Please, DO NOT DELETE ANY TEXT from this template! (unless instructed).
-->

## Proposed change
<!--
  Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the
  maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug
  or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue in the
  additional information section.
-->
The generic camera config flow now validates images during setup.  This has caused some problems where the still images were not identified correctly causing the user config flow or yaml import to fail, e.g. #69011

## Type of change
<!--
  What type of change does your PR introduce to Home Assistant?
  NOTE: Please, check only 1! box!
  If your PR requires multiple boxes to be checked, you'll most likely need to
  split it into multiple PRs. This makes things easier and faster to code review.
-->
This PR swaps the [deprecated](https://github.com/home-assistant/core/issues/68939#issuecomment-1085052293) imghdr library for the PIL (pillow) library.  This seems to be more effective at identifying images, and works for all the test cases supplied so far that I've tested.

This PR is to quickly resolve the issue.  I plan to follow up with pytests based on the sample images people have provided.

title: Having a problem adding broadlink intergration use device not supported its a RM4 mini which should be supported
body:
### The problem

Having a problem adding broadlink intergration it says device not supported when trying to add a RM4 mini which should be supported. 

### What version of Home Assistant Core has the issue?

core-2022.3.8

### What was the last working version of Home Assistant Core?

core-2022.3.8

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant Supervised

### Integration causing the issue

broadlink

### Link to integration documentation on our website

https://www.home-assistant.io/integrations/broadlink/

### Diagnostics information

Have made sure the device has same ip all the time in my router. Device works by itself just fine. Lock device is turned off in the broadlink app. Rebooted both device and HA. Broadlinks device firmware is v62092

title: network: fix starting with no configured IPv4 addresses
body:
<!--
  You are amazing! Thanks for contributing to our project!
  Please, DO NOT DELETE ANY TEXT from this template! (unless instructed).
-->

## Proposed change
A previous fix for a bug that happens when no IPv4 addresses are available on the system added an explicit error when this happens. However, Home Assistant can run just fine in a suitably configured IPv6-only environment, so this explicit error in fact constitutes a regression. So let's remove the error again and restore the functionality.

title: Unable to edit Glances configuration
body:
### The problem

Hi, I recently swapped router and my server got a new IP.
Everything is set up and now works with the new IP, but I am unable to edit the url used by Glances.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3661126/161135049-a90235cd-22f8-45b0-96a4-f97f2b9bbd8e.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3661126/161135093-2983d6c0-26d9-4bdf-8fa5-d5ea77f357ff.png)

It seems like this was possible in the past via the YAML-file, but this has since been removed. #50085 


### What version of Home Assistant Core has the issue?

title: Insteon - Unable to reach the modem
body:
### The problem

I'm a new user of HA trying to migrate from Homeseer and I've recently installed the Insteon Integration and I'm trying to migrate my existing 40+ Insteon network, however I'm having an issue with losing connectivity to the Insteon Hub model 2245-222. I have tried rebooting HA which sometime works but more often I need to reboot the hub to re-establish the connection to HA. When HA stops communicating to the Insteon hub I find the the native Insteon app has no issue reaching the hub and I have full control of all devices. Since I have installed the Insteon integration I don't think I have made it past 1 day before the connection is lost, for example rebooted yesterday afternoon and it appears the system went off line at a little before 1am this morning.
I'm hoping you can help me figure out why I'm having the issue.

Thanks for your time
Richard

### What version of Home Assistant Core has the issue?

core-2022.3.7

### What was the last working version of Home Assistant Core?

never worked however only been using HA for about a month

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Integration causing the issue

Insteon

_No response_

title: Pre-create hass.data namespace for domains
body:
<!--
  You are amazing! Thanks for contributing to our project!
  Please, DO NOT DELETE ANY TEXT from this template! (unless instructed).
-->
## Proposed change
<!--
  Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the
  maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug
  or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue in the
  additional information section.
-->

A common pattern in all (modern) integrations on setup is:

```py
if DOMAIN in hass.data:
  hass.data[DOMAIN] = {}
hass.data[DOMAIN][entry.entry_id] = client
```

or 

```py
hass.data.setdefault(DOMAIN, {})
hass.data[DOMAIN][entry.entry_id] = client
```

or

```py
hass.data.setdefault(DOMAIN, {})[entry.entry_id] = client
```

This PR initializes `hass.data` with an empty dictionary for each domain prior setup.
It removes the need for creating temporary (possible useless) dictionaries when using `setdefault` and eliminates a common pattern.

Allowing integrations to do just:

```py
hass.data[DOMAIN][entry.entry_id] = client
```

## Type of change

title: Add active alarm zones as select entity to Overkiz integration
body: ## Proposed change (marking as a draft for now since this is not important for current beta). Follow up of https://github.com/home-assistant/core/pull/68996. title: Fix Protexial alarm in Overkiz integration
body:
## Proposed change
The latest beta includes Alarm Control Panel (#67164); however this doesn't work for the Protexial alarm. Working with a user via Discord, I found the culprit and was able to fix this.

Apparently Overkiz expects a string, instead of a list... And for disarm, when `None` is passed in the args, it will make a list with None, and thus commands without parameters will throw an error.

I am not a huge fan of the current code; thus all feedback is appreciated.

title: Light entities not showing up correctly with zwave_me
body:
### The problem

I have problems with the new z-wave.me integration.

Lights that are shown correctly as "lights" in zway-server (dimmers and rgb led controllers) are just shown as a number input slider in HA. Shouldn't this be working? Seems linke they are recognised as multilevel-switches.

The same for covers, but i have seen that there will be support in future releases. Is there any date for the release?

### What version of Home Assistant Core has the issue?

core-2022.3.8

title: Mend incorrectly imported MQTT config entries
body:
<!--
  You are amazing! Thanks for contributing to our project!
  Please, DO NOT DELETE ANY TEXT from this template! (unless instructed).
-->
## Proposed change
<!--
  Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the
  maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug
  or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue in the
  additional information section.
-->
Mend incorrectly imported MQTT config entries

Background:
Starting with Home Assistant 2022.3 we ask users to remove basic MQTT broker configuration from `configuration.yaml`. However, in some cases the data imported from `configuration.yaml` may be incomplete.
This makes sure the config entry data has all the needed keys by importing deprecated configuration keys found in `configuration.yaml` but not in the config entry data.

title: Ecobee homekit sensor current temperature stops updating after reconnection
body:
### The problem

Ecobee homekit integration exposes two sensors with decimal precision, current_temperature and current_humidity.
Whenever HA reconnects to ecobee using homekit (for example ecobee thermostat is rebooted, ecobee establishes new DHCP assignment), the sensors for current_temperature and current_humidity no longer update, even if the climate state and attributes are updating.

### What version of Home Assistant Core has the issue?

2022.3.8

### What was the last working version of Home Assistant Core?

_No response_

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Integration causing the issue

homekit_controller

### Link to integration documentation on our website

_No response_

### Diagnostics information

_No response_

### Example YAML snippet

_No response_

### Anything in the logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
On HA UI, the sensor current_temperature flat lined around 10:45AM until HA was rebooted at around 10:54PM.

Before aiohomekit reconnected to ecobee, the temperature from ecobee was 19.7:

2022-03-30 10:47:13 DEBUG (MainThread) [aiohomekit.controller.ip.connection] 192.168.86.51: raw response: ... {"aid":1,"iid":19,"value":19.7}


Then a reconnection happens after ecobee thermostat is rebooted:

2022-03-30 10:48:02 DEBUG (MainThread) [aiohomekit.controller.ip.connection] Starting reconnect loop to 192.168.86.51:34244


Temperature from ecobee was still 19.7 after reconnection:

2022-03-30 10:48:09 DEBUG (MainThread) [aiohomekit.controller.ip.connection] 192.168.86.51: raw response: ... {"iid":19,"type":"11","format":"float","value":19.7,"perms":["pr","ev"],"ev":true,"unit":"celsius","minValue":0,"maxValue":40.0,"minStep":0.1}


But later when heating turned on, the temperature went up to 21.2, but the sensor current_temperature was stuck at old value of 19.7:

2022-03-30 11:05:13 DEBUG (MainThread) [aiohomekit.controller.ip.connection] 192.168.86.51: raw response: ... {"aid":1,"iid":19,"value":21.2}

The sensor was no longer updating until HA was rebooted at 10:54PM.
```


### Additional information

_No response_

title: Deprecate temperature conversion in base entity class
body:
<!--
  You are amazing! Thanks for contributing to our project!
  Please, DO NOT DELETE ANY TEXT from this template! (unless instructed).
-->
## Breaking change
Temperatures in entity states will no longer be converted to the temperature unit in the configured unit system (imperial or metric) in Home Assistant Core 2022.7.
This may may affect custom components:
 - Sensors should be updated to inherit `SensorEntity`.
 - Non sensors need to implement temperature unit conversion.

Note that entities such as climate, weather, water heater etc. are not affected because they expose temperatures in entity attributes, not in the entity state.

## Proposed change
<!--
  Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the
  maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug
  or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue in the
  additional information section.
-->
Deprecate temperature conversion in base entity class, it was only useful for sensors which now do their own unit conversion.

Same idea as https://github.com/home-assistant/core/pull/68926, but with a 3 month deprecation period + warning

title: Unifi Protect Doorbell issue
body:
### The problem

When the connection between the Unifi Controller and Home-Assistant drops for a bit, for instance because of a firmware update, it "rings" the doorbell in Home-Assistant when the connection is back, even when the doorbell isn't rang by any user at the door. Pretty confusing.

### What version of Home Assistant Core has the issue?

2022.3.8

### What was the last working version of Home Assistant Core?

_No response_

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant Supervised

### Integration causing the issue

Unifi Protect

### Link to integration documentation on our website

https://www.home-assistant.io/integrations/unifiprotect/

### Diagnostics information

_No response_

### Example YAML snippet

_No response_

### Anything in the logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
Nope, sadly not.
```


### Additional information

Easy to reproduce, just make sure the connection drops for a second (or longer) between Home-Assistant and your Unifi Protect controller. When it comes back the doorbell "rings".
